title: [Large-scale] Self-Regulated Learning Strategies and Behavioral Analytics Design for Online Math Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic pedagogical knowledge in mathematics and proficiency in digital device usage
context.additional_context: A course for current elementary teachers to strengthen math instruction competencies in mobile environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain self-regulated learning-based mathematics instruction methods on online platforms with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can improve learning efficiency by implementing cognitive processing behaviors (note-taking, problem-solving) at over 70% during video content viewing.
Learners can design and evaluate personalized mathematics instruction strategies based on learning behavior analytics data.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
